results.title: Auslan for families [five stories]
results.creator_credit: Raffi Ghazarian, Chisholm Institute Education Development Unit and VSDC Services for Deaf Children
results.brief_description: Companion piece to ‘Auslan for families: vocabulary. Episodes 1-5’ [313556], in which the signs demonstrated there are acted out in five scenes of varying length around the themes of family, school, shopping, food and play. Intended as a language teaching program for parents of deaf children from a non-English speaking background; a voiceover accompanies the signing. Performers include: Kathryn Smith, Gerard Hynes, Caitlyn Johnson, Trent Beasly.

results.title: Atlantic parks = Parcs Atlantique
results.creator_credit: Andre Belleau, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An exploration of three of Canada’s National Parks; Fundy, Prince Edward Island and Cape Breton Highlands, all on the Atlantic coast, where, by filmmaker’s licence’ boy meets girl, marries and has a family, all while enjoying the park’s many other rewards for autocampers. Even the girl’s little white car, which leads us to the parks at the outset, seems to run on the pure air and the anticipation of fresh adventures around the next turn.

results.title: Aunt Julia and the scriptwriter
results.creator_credit: Jon Amiel, Mark Tarlov, John Fiedler, Odyssey and Cinecom Entertainment
results.brief_description: Released in the United States as “Tune in tomorrow”, this is John Amiel’s screen version of Mario Vargas Llosa’s acclaimed novel “Aunt Julia and the scriptwriter”. Aunt Julia (Barbara Hershey), a double divorcee, returns to New Orleans at age 36 to find a wealthy third husband. Instead, she finds her 21-year-old nephew by marriage (Keanu Reeves), a local radio station newswriter, who falls in love with her. She succumbs to his advances, incurring her family’s anger. The plot is overlaid with the more complicated story of a dishevelled writer, Falk, who is new in town. Falk manipulates the nephew-aunt relationship in his radio soap opera which is laced with incest and anti-Albanian sentiment. This is a clever and witty romantic comedy that features an amazing supporting cast including John Laroquette, Elizabeth McGovern, Dennis Quaid and others.

results.title: Aubusson tapestries
results.creator_credit: P. Biro, P. Hirsch, Jean Lods, Les Actualites Francaises and A F Filmac Inc
results.brief_description: The making of modern tapestry. Jean Lureat, the famous French artist, designs an original creation which is brought into existence by the weavers of Aubusson

results.title: Attiuk
results.creator_credit: Rene Bonniere, Pierre Perrault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: To understand the life of the Montagnais, you have to walk twelve days on snowshoes as far as Lake Musquaro in search of the caribou, following a dream contained within the skins of the drum that the elders patiently craft, like a canoe. The hunters hunt the caribou, which provide the skins for their drums which give them their dreams, which brings them the caribou.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rene Bonniere, Pierre Perrault and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Attack of the 50ft woman
results.creator_credit: Nathan Hertz, Bernard Woolner and Woolner Productions
results.brief_description: No one believes Nancy Archer has encountered a giant alien from outer space in the desert one night. The local sheriff and her doctor think she is suffering from hallucinations. Her husband, Harry, is openly having an affair and wants Nancy committed to an asylum so he can take her money and enjoy a life of lustful luxury. It soon becomes quite obvious Nancy is telling the truth when she grows into a 50ft woman who soon becomes a towering menace as she seeks out her husband and his lover to get even.

results.title: Astroboy 02
results.creator_credit: Satoshi Yamamoto, Hidehiko Takei and Tezuka Productions
results.brief_description: Three episodes in the adventures of the boy robot, created by Osamu Tezuka. The episodes are: ‘Astro’s first love’, ‘Save the Carolina 3’ and ‘Astro fights aliens’.
